question: Let $A= \{(1, -2, 0), (2, 3, 2), (3, 1, 2)\}$ and $B= \{(1, -2, 0), (1, 0, 2), (1, -1, 3)\}$ be sets of vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is linearly independent but $A$ is not
answer3: $A$ is linearly independent but $B$ is not

$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system, the plane $\pi:2x+3y-z+5=0$ and the point $P=(-1, 2, 4)$. The distance from $P$ to $\pi$ is:

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & 2z & = & a \\
x & + & 2y & + & z & = & b \\
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
4x & + & 3y & + & 4z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has solutions if and only if $a=-2$ and $b=5$. 
In this case, there is an infinite number of solution, which are of the form $\left(x,\,4,\,-3-x\right)$ for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer2:
The system has solutions if and only if $a \neq \frac{7}{4}$ and $b \neq \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the solutions are of the form $\left(\frac{3}{4}a-z,\,\frac{1}{4}b,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has solutions if and only if $a = \frac{7}{4}$ and $b = \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the unique solution is $\left(\frac{3}{4},\,\frac{1}{4},\,0\right)$.

question: Differentiate $y = \dfrac{\operatorname{e}^{-3x}}{x^2+1}$.
Consider $f(x,y) = x + x^3y^2 - 2y^2x$. Find $f_{x}(2,1)$.

At the HealthPlus hospital, the nursing staff works in $6$ different shifts. Each shift has a duration of $8$ hours, with its start interval of $4$ hours (the first shift starts at $8:00$ AM, the second at $12:00$ AM, the third at $4:00$ p.m., and so on). The number of nurses required during the day is in the following table. How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized to allow planning the nursing staff, considering that $x_{i}$ is the number of nurses working in shift $i~(i = 1~to~6)$?

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|}
\hline
\text{Day period} & \text{Required number of nurses} \\
\hline
\text{8:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m.} & 140 \\
\text{12:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.} & 120 \\
\text{4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.} & 160 \\
\text{8:00 p.m. to 12:00 p.m.} & 90 \\
\text{12:00 p.m. to 4:00 a.m.} & 30 \\
\text{4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.} & 60 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
answer2:
\[
		\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Minimize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^5 x_{i}\\			
		\text{subject to} & x_{1}+x_{2}\geq 120\\			
		& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\
		&x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\
		&x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\
		&x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~5\\ 
		\end{array}
	     \]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^6 x_{i}\\
			\text{subject to} & x_{1}+x_{2}\geq 120\\
			& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\
			& x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\
			& x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\
			& x_{5}+x_{6}\geq 60\\
			& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~6\\
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll} 
				\text{Minimize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^6 x_{i}\\			
			\text{subject to} &  x_{1}+x_{6}\geq 140\\			
			& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\			
			& x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\			
			& x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\			
			& x_{5}+x_{6}\geq 60\\
			\end{array}
			\]

Medical researchers analyze how different dosages of a drug affect the duration of relief from allergic symptoms. They want to develop a statistical model to predict the time of relief (in days) based on the dosage of a new drug. Identify the predictor variable and the response variable.
answer1: The predictor variable is a dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the time of relief.
answer2: The predictor variable is the time of relief; the response variable is the dosage of the new drug.
answer3: The predictor variable is the mean of time of relief; the response variable is the mean of dosage of the new drug.
answer4: The predictor variable is the mean of dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the mean of time of relief.

question: Conclude about the existence of local maxima, local minima, and saddle points of $f\left(x,y\right)=x^4+y^4-4xy$.
answer1: There are $2$ local minima, and a saddle point.
answer2: There are $2$ local minima, and $2$ local maxima.
answer3: There are $2$ local maxima, and a saddle point.
answer4: There are $2$ local minima, a saddle point, and $1$ local maximum.

$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
 & & y & + & 3z & = & 2 \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,\frac{y}{2}\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,-2,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & z & - & t & = & 1\\
x & - & 2y & + & 3z & + & t &  = & 1\\
x & - & y & + & 3z & + & t & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\}$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & = & 2 \\
3x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has two solutions, $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ and $\left(2,\,1,\,0\right)$.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(-4+z,\,z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Consider $m \neq 0$. Make $x$ the subject of the expression

$y=mx+c$

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question: Let $A= \{(1, -2, 0), (2, 3, 2), (3, 1, 2)\}$ and $B= \{(1, -2, 0), (1, 0, 2), (1, -1, 3)\}$ be sets of vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is linearly independent but $A$ is not
answer3: $A$ is linearly independent but $B$ is not

question:

\hline
x & 0 & 4 & 8 & 12 & 16 & 20 \\ 
\hline
f(x) & 30 & 20 & 10 & 20 & 15 & 8 \\
\hline
\end{array}$$

Calculate, in the sense of minimum least squares method, the polynomial of degree $1$ that fits the data.

3x & + & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1\\
x & - & y & + &2 z & - & 4t & = & -1\\
-x & - & 2y & - & z & + & t & = & 0\\
2x & + & 3y & - & 2z & + & t & = & 2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has a unique solution.
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.

question: To develop a stock portfolio wherein the objective is to maximize return and minimize risk, you would have to use
Which of the following statements is correct?
answer1: Matrix multiplication is always commutative if both matrices are diagonal matrices
answer2: Matrix multiplication is always commutative if both matrices are symmetric matrices
answer3: Matrix multiplication is not always commutative if one matrix is the identity matrix
answer4: none of the options given are correct

question: Solving an integer programming problem by rounding off answers obtained by solving it as a linear programming problem (using simplex), it is possible to conclude that
answer1: the value of the objective function for a maximization problem will likely be less than the simplex solution.
answer2: the values of decision variables obtained by rounding off are always very close to the optimal values.
answer3: the value of the objective function for a minimization problem will likely be less than the simplex solution.

question:
Construct the dual problem for the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 2x_{1} - 2x_{2} + 3x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & -x_{1} + x_{2} + x_{3}\leq 4 \\
& 2x_{1}-x_{2}+x_{3}\leq 2 \\
& x_{1}+x_{2}+3x_{3}\leq 12 \\
&  x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
Indicate which of the following set of vectors is a spanning set of $\mathbb{R}^2$.
Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

question: Choose two vectors of $V=\left\{(-10,5),(2,-1),(-5,1),(2,0),\left(\dfrac{1}{2},2\right),\left(2,\dfrac{1}{2}\right)\right\}$ which are linearly dependent.

Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 2 \\ 
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\ 
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{1}{3}+\frac{5}{3}z,\,\frac{4}{3}+\frac{2}{3}z,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has two solutions: $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ and $\left(0,\,2,\,-1\right)$.

question: Let $A= \{(1, -2, 0), (2, 3, 2), (3, 1, 2)\}$ and $B= \{(1, -2, 0), (1, 0, 2), (1, -1, 3)\}$ be sets of vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is linearly independent but $A$ is not
answer3: $A$ is linearly independent but $B$ is not
